title: 114_s1310
content: The Act may be cited as the "Deficit Reduction Through Fair Oil Royalties Act" and pertains to eligibility for new leases and the transfer of leases. The "Deficit Reduction Through Fair Oil Royalties Act" defines a "covered lease" as an existing lease for oil or gas production in the Gulf of Mexico issued by the Secretary under specific conditions. The term "lessee" includes any person or entity related to the lessee. The "Deficit Reduction Through Fair Oil Royalties Act" defines a "covered lease" as an existing lease for oil or gas production in the Gulf of Mexico issued by the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary shall not issue new leases for oil or gas production unless the lessee renegotiates to pay royalties if oil and gas prices exceed certain thresholds. The "Deficit Reduction Through Fair Oil Royalties Act" defines a "covered lease" as an existing lease for oil or gas production in the Gulf of Mexico. A person referred to in the Act includes a lessee holding a covered lease on the date of issuance or transferring it to another entity after the enactment of the Act, as well as any person with a direct or indirect interest in a covered lease. Multiple lessees are also considered under the Act. The Secretary may implement separate agreements with multiple lessees owning a share of a covered lease to modify payment responsibilities, including price thresholds. Shares under the agreement are not considered covered leases. The lessee or any person with an interest in a lease cannot transfer any covered lease or its economic benefits without renegotiating the lease to include specified price thresholds. The lessee or any person with an interest in a lease must adhere to specified price thresholds when transferring covered leases or their economic benefits. Amounts received as rentals or royalties under these leases are to be used for Federal budget deficit reduction or, if there is no deficit, for reducing the deficit further. The lessee or any person with an interest in a lease must adhere to specified price thresholds when transferring covered leases or their economic benefits. Amounts received as rentals or royalties under these leases are to be used for Federal budget deficit reduction or, if there is no deficit, for reducing the Federal debt as deemed appropriate by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary of the Interior can amend leases for Gulf of Mexico tracts to include price thresholds for royalty suspension provisions. The new thresholds will be effective from October 1, 2015, while existing lease provisions will remain until September 30, 2015.
